CONJUGATES: noun: cone | cones | verb: cone | cones | coning | coned | coned
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English cone, from Old French cone, from Latin cōnus, from Ancient Greek kōnos (κώνoς) 'pine cone, spinning top, cone'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A solid or hollow object that tapers from a circular or roughly circular base to a point.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 从圆形或大致圆形底部逐渐变细到一个点的固体或空心物体。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The ice cream was served in a sugar cone.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 冰淇淋装在一个糖筒里。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A plastic marker, typically orange or red, placed on a road to indicate roadworks or a temporary obstruction.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种通常为橙色或红色的塑料标记，放置在路上以指示道路施工或临时障碍。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Traffic cones were placed around the construction site to guide vehicles.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 交通锥筒被放置在施工现场周围，以引导车辆。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The fruit of a conifer (such as a pine, fir, or cedar), typically woody and conical, containing the seeds. Or, one of the light-sensitive cells in the retina of the eye, responsible for color vision.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 针叶树（如松树、冷杉或雪松）的果实，通常木质且呈锥形，内含种子。或，视网膜中对光敏感的细胞之一，负责彩色视觉。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Pine cones often fall from the trees in autumn. / Cones in the eye allow us to perceive different colors.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 松果常在秋天从树上落下。/ 眼睛中的视锥细胞使我们能够感知不同的颜色。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A transitive verb; a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To shape something into a cone or conical form.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The potter coned the clay on the wheel before centering it.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 陶艺师在将粘土居中之前，先在转轮上将其塑成锥形。
